1.description: Bilbo Baggins' cousin and adopted heir. Lives comfortably at Bag End and is well-regarded among hobbits. About to turn 50, which is considered the coming of age for hobbits. Shares Bilbo's love of maps, stories, and the wider world.

2.description: Learns the truth about Bilbo's magic ring from Gandalf - it is the One Ring of power, created by the Dark Lord Sauron. Despite the terrible burden, he accepts the responsibility of destroying it to save Middle-earth.

6.description: Sets out from Bag End with Sam and Pippin, beginning the quest to destroy the Ring. Shows courage in leaving his comfortable life behind, though he doesn't yet understand the full scope of what lies ahead.

1.description: Frodo's gardener at Bag End. A practical, loyal hobbit with a love of growing things. Lives with his father, the Gaffer, and has rarely been far from Hobbiton.

2.description: Caught eavesdropping on Gandalf's conversation about the Ring. Despite the danger, he insists on accompanying Frodo on the quest, showing unwavering loyalty to his master.

1.description: A wizard who has long been a friend to the hobbits. Known for his fireworks and stories from the outside world. Returns to the Shire after a long absence, seeking Bilbo on important business.

2.description: Reveals himself as one of the wise who opposes the Dark Lord. He has spent years researching Bilbo's ring and discovered its true nature as the One Ring of power. Urges Frodo to leave the Shire immediately.

6.description: A young hobbit of the Took family, known for being adventurous and somewhat reckless. Joins Frodo's journey more out of loyalty and curiosity than understanding of the danger involved.
A hobbit of the Brandybuck family and one of Frodo's cousins. More mature and thoughtful than Pippin, but equally loyal. Has been planning to help Frodo for some time.

10.description: A mysterious Ranger who frequents the inn at Bree. Tall, dark, and weather-worn, with a stern face and grey eyes. Other travelers avoid him, calling him 'Strider.' He seems to know more about the hobbits than he should.

11.description: Reveals he was sent by Gandalf to watch for Frodo. Offers to guide the hobbits to Rivendell, warning them of the great danger they face from the Black Riders. His knowledge of the wild and the enemy makes him invaluable.

19.description: A man of Gondor who has come to Rivendell seeking answers to a prophetic dream. Tall and proud, with a bearing that speaks of nobility and martial prowess. Son of Denethor, the Ruling Steward of Gondor.

20.description: Chosen as a member of the Fellowship of the Ring. Though brave and skilled in battle, he is troubled by the growing power of Mordor threatening his homeland and believes the Ring could be used to defend Gondor.

relationships.The One Ring: Believes could be used as weapon

19.description: An Elf of the Woodland Realm, son of King Thranduil. Tall and fair with keen grey eyes, skilled with bow and blade. Has come to Rivendell with news of Gollum's escape.

20.description: Chosen as a member of the Fellowship, representing the Elves. His keen senses and woodland skills make him invaluable for the journey ahead.

19.description: A Dwarf warrior, son of Glóin who was one of Thorin's companions. Stocky and strong with a magnificent beard, he bears an axe and wears mail. Has come to Rivendell with disturbing news from the Lonely Mountain.

20.description: Chosen as a member of the Fellowship, representing the Dwarves. Despite ancient enmities between Elves and Dwarves, he agrees to travel with Legolas for the greater good.

19.description: The Lord of Rivendell and master of the hidden valley. Ancient and wise, with the light of the Elder Days still in his eyes. Keeper of Vilya, one of the Three Rings of the Elves. Healer of Frodo's wound from the Morgul-blade.

20.description: Presides over the Council that decides the fate of the Ring. Despite his power and wisdom, he recognizes that the Ring cannot be used by anyone and must be destroyed. Supports Frodo's decision to bear this burden.

1.description: Frodo's beloved cousin and former guardian. Left Bag End seventeen years ago on his 111th birthday in mysterious circumstances, leaving everything to Frodo. Known throughout the Shire for his wealth and eccentricity.

18.description: Residing peacefully in Rivendell, writing his memoirs and composing songs. Has aged little since leaving the Ring behind and seems more content than he was in his final years at Bag End.

1.description: Sam's father, an elderly hobbit known throughout Hobbiton as 'the Gaffer.' Works as a gardener and is full of opinions and local gossip. Suspicious of outsiders and change.

10.description: The fat, bald, and good-natured innkeeper of the Prancing Pony in Bree. Somewhat absent-minded but well-meaning. Has been expecting the hobbits but forgot an important message.

11.description: Reveals he was supposed to deliver Gandalf's letter to Frodo but forgot. Apologizes profusely and vouches for Strider's character, though he admits the Ranger makes him nervous.

10.description: A young hobbit who works as a servant at the Prancing Pony inn in Bree. Quick and helpful, he assists Butterbur with the guests and stable work.
A man of Bree who works at the Prancing Pony, handling the stables and ponies. Reliable and knows the local area well.

11.description: A sly, squint-eyed man from Bree who keeps a sickly pony. Sells the animal to the hobbits at an outrageous price, showing little concern for its welfare.

12.description: Revealed to be in league with the enemy, providing information about the hobbits' movements. Watches their departure with suspicious interest.

11.description: A small, rough pony bought from Bill Ferny. Initially in poor condition from neglect and abuse, but proves hardy and reliable once properly cared for by Sam.

7.description: A mysterious and jolly figure who lives in the Old Forest. Appears suddenly singing nonsense songs, with a blue coat and yellow boots. Shows mastery over the trees and saves the hobbits from Old Man Willow.

8.description: Proves immune to the Ring's power, making it vanish and reappear at will without being affected. Claims to be older than the trees and remembers the first raindrop and acorn. His true nature remains mysterious.

7.description: Tom Bombadil's wife, described as the River-woman's daughter. Beautiful and graceful, with a voice like water running over stone. Gathers water-lilies and commands the streams.

8.description: Hosts the hobbits with grace and kindness, providing them with comfort and wisdom. Her presence brings peace and her laughter is like music. She and Tom exist in harmony with the natural world.

6.description: An ancient and malevolent willow tree in the Old Forest. Has the power to cast drowsiness and trap travelers within its trunk. The most dangerous and cunning of all the hostile trees.

5.description: An Elf-lord of the House of Finrod who leads a company of Elves traveling through the Shire. Wise and noble, he recognizes the danger the hobbits face and provides counsel and protection for the night.

16.description: A mighty Elf-lord of Rivendell who rides out to find Frodo and his companions. Tall and noble with bright golden hair, he commands great power and the Nazgûl fear him.

17.description: Places Frodo on his horse Asfaloth to speed toward the Ford of Bruinen. His presence alone is enough to slow the pursuing Nazgûl, and he helps coordinate Frodo's rescue.

16.description: Glorfindel's white horse, swift and fearless. Understands the urgency of bearing Frodo to safety and runs faster than any earthly steed to outpace the Nine Riders.

19.description: Elrond's daughter, fairest of the children of Ilúvatar. Dark-haired and grey-eyed with the light of stars in her glance. Called Undómiel, the Evenstar of her people.
One of Thorin's former companions, now an elder statesman among the Dwarves of Erebor. Father of Gimli and bearer of disturbing news about messengers from Mordor seeking information about hobbits.
One of Thorin's companions who left Erebor thirty years ago to reclaim Moria. No word has been heard from his expedition for twenty-five years, causing great concern among the Dwarves.

22.description: Found entombed in Moria, having died defending the Chamber of Mazarbul. His tomb bears the inscription 'Balin son of Fundin, Lord of Moria.' The Book of Records tells of his brave but doomed attempt to reclaim the ancient kingdom.
One of Thorin's former companions who accompanied Balin to Moria. Scribe who wrote the final desperate entries in the Book of Mazarbul before the colony's destruction.

19.description: The Lady of Lothlórien, mightiest and fairest of all the Elves that remain in Middle-earth. Bearer of Nenya, one of the Three Rings. Her wisdom and power are legendary among all Free Peoples.

relationships.Nenya: Bearer of Elven Ring of Water

19.description: Lord of Lothlórien and husband of Galadriel. Wise and noble, with silver hair and great knowledge of the lands of Middle-earth. Rules alongside his wife in the golden wood.

21.description: A march-warden of Lothlórien who guards the borders of the Golden Wood. Tall and fair-haired, he initially challenges the Fellowship but becomes their guide and protector within the realm.
One of Haldir's brothers, also a march-warden of Lothlórien. Guards the borders of the Golden Wood alongside his brothers, watching for intruders and threats.
One of Haldir's brothers, also a march-warden of Lothlórien. Works with his brothers to guard the borders and guide worthy travelers through the Golden Wood.

23.description: An ancient demon of shadow and flame sleeping in the depths of Moria. One of Morgoth's most terrible servants from the Elder Days, it destroyed Balin's colony and now awakens to the presence of the Fellowship.

24.description: Confronts Gandalf at the Bridge of Khazad-dûm in a battle of shadow and flame. When Gandalf breaks the bridge, both wizard and demon fall into the abyss, locked in deadly combat.

2.description: The Dark Lord of Mordor who forged the One Ring to control all other Rings of Power. Thought destroyed long ago, but his spirit endured and he has now returned to his fortress of Barad-dûr, seeking to reclaim his Ring.

18.description: Has been steadily rebuilding his power in Mordor, gathering armies and seeking the Ring. His influence spreads as the Shadow grows, and his servants search all lands for news of the Ring.
Chief of the order of Wizards and head of the White Council. Has been studying the arts of the Enemy and has betrayed the Free Peoples, seeking the Ring for himself.

19.description: Revealed to have imprisoned Gandalf and allied himself with Mordor. He commands armies of orcs from his stronghold of Isengard and seeks to claim the Ring when Frodo is captured.

12.description: Chief and most terrible of the Nine Nazgûl. Once a great king of men who accepted a Ring of Power from Sauron and was enslaved to his will. Now leads the hunt for the Ring-bearer.

13.description: Leads the attack on Weathertop, wielding a Morgul-blade that wounds Frodo. His presence fills all nearby with terror, and his cry pierces the night with deadly cold.

4.description: A hobbit farmer in the Marish who owns fierce dogs and is known for chasing mushroom thieves. Frodo remembers being frightened of him as a young hobbit for stealing mushrooms.

5.description: Proves to be friendly and helpful, giving the hobbits food and safe passage to the ferry. Reveals that a Black Rider came asking about Baggins, showing the Enemy's reach extends even into the Shire.

4.description: Farmer Maggot's wife, a kindly hobbit woman who welcomes the travelers and provides them with a hearty meal before they continue their journey.
One of Farmer Maggot's large and fierce guard dogs, bred to keep intruders and thieves away from the farm.
One of Farmer Maggot's large and fierce guard dogs, trained to protect the farm from unwanted visitors.
One of Farmer Maggot's large and fierce guard dogs, helping to keep the farm secure from thieves and intruders.

5.description: A hobbit friend of Frodo's who is part of the conspiracy to help him leave the Shire. Plump and good-natured, he knows about Frodo's plans and helps with the deception.

6.description: Stays behind at Crickhollow to maintain the pretense that Frodo still lives there, showing considerable courage in facing potential danger alone.

1.description: A hobbit of Hobbiton who works at the mill. Known for being a gossip and somewhat unpleasant, always ready with a snide comment about his betters.
A pretty young hobbit lass who works at the Green Dragon inn. Sam is quite taken with her, though he's too shy to say much about it.
Bilbo's disagreeable relative who has long coveted Bag End. Sharp-featured and sharp-tongued, she has been waiting years for a chance to claim the property.
Bilbo's relative and Lobelia's husband. Less aggressive than his wife but equally interested in claiming Bag End and the Baggins inheritance.
An elderly hobbit of Bywater who is known for his opinions on weather and farming. Often found at the Green Dragon sharing news and gossip.
A hobbit who frequents the Green Dragon inn, known for his contributions to local gossip and conversation about recent strange happenings.

10.description: A gate-keeper of Bree who is somewhat suspicious of strangers but eventually allows the hobbits to enter the town after dark.
A hobbit patron at the Prancing Pony who joins in the conversation and shows interest in the newcomers from the Shire.
A man of Bree who drinks at the Prancing Pony and participates in the evening's conversations and entertainment.

13.description: The last High King of the Elves in Middle-earth, remembered in ancient song. Fell in the final battle against Sauron at the end of the Second Age.
Son of Elendil who cut the Ring from Sauron's hand but failed to destroy it when he had the chance. His weakness led to the Ring's survival and the current crisis.
Great king of the Dúnedain who founded Gondor and Arnor. Father of Isildur, he wielded the sword Narsil and died fighting Sauron in the Last Alliance.

21.description: One of the three great peaks of the Misty Mountains that stand above Moria. Called Silvertine by men, it watches over the ancient dwarf-kingdom below.
The cruel mountain that defeats the Fellowship's attempt to cross the Redhorn Pass. Seems to have a malevolent will, sending terrible storms and avalanches to bar their way.

5.description: The Queen of the Stars, mightiest of the Valar who dwells in the heavens. Her name is a prayer and protection against the servants of darkness.

recaps.1: Frodo Baggins celebrates his fiftieth birthday in the Shire, seventeen years after Bilbo's disappearance. Gandalf the Grey returns with urgent news about Bilbo's magic ring.
recaps.2: Gandalf reveals that Bilbo's ring is actually the One Ring of Power, created by the Dark Lord Sauron. Frodo must leave the Shire immediately to prevent Sauron from reclaiming it.
recaps.3: Frodo prepares for his departure, selling Bag End and planning his route. Sam is discovered eavesdropping and insists on accompanying his master on the dangerous journey.
recaps.4: The hobbits set out through the Shire, but encounter a mysterious Black Rider searching for 'Baggins.' They hide and continue their journey with growing unease.
recaps.5: The travelers meet Gildor and a company of Elves in the woods. The Elves provide food and shelter, and Gildor warns Frodo about the Black Riders pursuing him.
recaps.6: Frodo, Sam, and Pippin are joined by Merry, who reveals he has known about Frodo's plans. They travel through the Old Forest, where the trees seem hostile and watchful.
recaps.7: The hobbits are trapped by Old Man Willow, a malevolent tree. They are rescued by Tom Bombadil, a mysterious and powerful being who seems immune to the Ring's influence.
recaps.8: The hobbits stay with Tom Bombadil and his wife Goldberry. Tom tells them stories of the ancient days and tests the Ring, showing he is unaffected by its power.
recaps.9: Tom Bombadil guides the hobbits to the edge of his lands. They enter the Barrow-downs, where they are captured by a Barrow-wight but rescued again by Tom.
recaps.10: The hobbits reach the town of Bree and stay at the Prancing Pony inn. Frodo accidentally puts on the Ring and disappears, drawing unwanted attention to their party.
recaps.11: A Ranger called Strider approaches the hobbits, claiming Gandalf sent him to watch for them. Despite their suspicions, they agree to let him guide them to Rivendell.
recaps.12: Strider leads the hobbits through the wild, avoiding the roads where the Black Riders search. They learn these creatures are Nazgûl, former kings enslaved by Rings of Power.
recaps.13: The company reaches Weathertop, ancient watchtower of the North Kingdom. Despite Strider's warnings, Frodo puts on the Ring and is attacked by the Nazgûl.
recaps.14: Frodo is wounded by a Morgul-blade but Strider drives off the Nazgûl with fire. The wound is beyond normal healing, and Frodo begins to fade between the worlds.
recaps.15: The journey continues with Frodo growing weaker from his wound. They are pursued relentlessly by the Nine Riders as they make their way toward the Ford of Bruinen.
recaps.16: The company is found by the Elf-lord Glorfindel, who puts Frodo on his horse Asfaloth. They race toward Rivendell with the Nazgûl in close pursuit.
recaps.17: Frodo reaches the Ford of Rivendell just ahead of the Nine Riders. The river rises to sweep away the Nazgûl, and Frodo collapses from his wound.
recaps.18: Frodo awakens in Rivendell, healed by Elrond's power. He is reunited with Gandalf, who explains his long absence and the growing threat of Sauron.
recaps.19: Frodo attends the Council of Elrond, where representatives of the Free Peoples debate what to do with the Ring. The history of the Ring and the growing Shadow is revealed.
recaps.20: The Council concludes that the Ring cannot be used and must be destroyed in the fires of Mount Doom. Frodo volunteers to bear this burden, and the Fellowship is formed to protect him.
recaps.21: The Fellowship attempts to cross the Redhorn Pass but is turned back by a blizzard. They decide to take the dangerous path through the abandoned dwarf-city of Moria.
recaps.22: The Fellowship enters Moria and discovers the fate of Balin's colony - all the dwarves have been slain by orcs. They find Balin's tomb and the record of the colony's last days.
recaps.23: The Fellowship is attacked by orcs in the Chamber of Mazarbul. They flee deeper into Moria but awaken an ancient evil - a Balrog of Morgoth sleeping in the depths.
recaps.24: At the Bridge of Khazad-dûm, Gandalf confronts the Balrog to allow the others to escape. Both wizard and demon fall into the abyss, and the Fellowship flees Moria in grief.
